repo_notes.content: dcyfr-ai-sandbox is an experimentation and testing environment for AI agent development. Safe space for prototyping new agents, testing LLM integrations, validating workflows before promotion to production packages. Uses both @dcyfr/ai framework and @dcyfr/agents.
repo_notes.author: DCYFR Workspace Agent

repo_notes.content: Purpose: Rapid prototyping of agent capabilities, testing new MCP servers, experimenting with delegation patterns, validating agent personas before production deployment, benchmarking LLM provider performance, testing memory layer strategies.
repo_notes.author: DCYFR Workspace Agent

repo_notes.content: Structure: experiments/ (one-off agent prototypes), benchmarks/ (performance testing), examples/ (reference implementations), tests/ (integration testing sandbox). All code here is considered experimental and may not be production-ready.
repo_notes.author: DCYFR Workspace Agent

repo_notes.content: Testing patterns: Use sandbox for validating breaking changes to @dcyfr/ai, testing agent reputation scoring, experimenting with new LLM models, prototyping custom tools, validating delegation contracts before deploying to dcyfr-labs.
repo_notes.author: DCYFR Workspace Agent

pages.title: Sandbox Overview
pages.purpose: Purpose of sandbox environment, experimentation workflow, graduation criteria for promoting code to production packages, safety guidelines

pages.title: Experimental Agents
pages.purpose: Agent prototypes in experiments/, testing new capabilities, persona experimentation, delegation pattern validation, what makes an agent ready for production

pages.title: MCP Server Prototypes
pages.purpose: Experimental MCP servers, testing new tool integrations, protocol validation, performance benchmarking before production deployment

pages.title: Benchmarking Suite
pages.purpose: Performance benchmarks in benchmarks/, LLM provider comparison, agent execution metrics, memory usage profiling, latency testing

pages.title: Integration Testing
pages.purpose: Sandbox-specific integration tests, testing @dcyfr/ai + @dcyfr/agents interaction, validating breaking changes, cross-package compatibility checks

pages.title: Examples & Tutorials
pages.purpose: Reference implementations in examples/, how to use @dcyfr/ai framework, common agent patterns, MCP server examples, delegation examples
